description: TO PASS H. R. 10, A BILL SETTLING THE LAND CLAIM OF JACOB SCHAEFER, AND HONORABLY DISCHARGED ARMY VETERAN.
TO ADOPT THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON ELECTIONS GIVING PARMINIO ADAMS OF N. Y. A SEAT IN THE HOUSE.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 5 (APP. 6/30/1824), A BILL TO OBTAIN SURVEYS, PLANS AND ESTIMATES OF ROADS AND CANALS.
TO RECOMMIT H. R. 5 TO THE COMMITTEE ON ROADS AND CANALS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO DESIGNATE THE ROADS AND CANALS MOST NECESSARY FOR THE PUBLIC GOOD.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 5.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 5.
TO AMEND H. R. 78 (APP. 3/10/1824), A BILL MAKING MILITARY APPROPRIATIONS FOR 1824, BY REQUIRING THE CONSENT OF N. Y. STATE FOR THE PURCHASE OF GRIDLEY'S FARM AT WEST POINT.
TO AMEND H. R. 78 (APP. 3/10/1824), A BILL MAKING MILITARY APPROPRIATIONS, BY ELIMINATING THE $10,000 APPROPRIATION FOR THE PURCHASE OF GRIDLEY'S FARM.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION PROPOSING CERTAIN INQUIRIES BY THE COMMITTEE OF WAYS AND MEANS, RESPECTING THE OPERATION OF THE PROPOSED TARIFF.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION WITH PROPOSED AMENDMENTS REQUIRING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO INVESTIGATE AND REPORT THE OPERATION OF THE PROPOSED TARIFF.
TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION REQUIRING THE COMMITTEE OF WAYS AND MEANS TO REPORT THE EFFECT OF THE PROPOSED TARIFF BILL ON U. S. REVENUE.
TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE HOUSE ADJOURN AT TWELVE O'CLOCK.
TO AMEND THE 31ST RULE OF THE HOUSE, STATING THAT THE MOTION TO ADJOURN IS ONLY IN ORDER AFTER 4 P.M., BY PROVIDING THAT THE MOTION IS ALWAYS IN ORDER.

TO CONCUR AS IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE IN THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 77 (APP. 4/2/1824), A BILL MAKING GENERAL APPROPRI- ATIONS FOR 1824, WHICH AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $26,000 FOR FINISHING THE NORTH PORTICO OF THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSE.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION STATING THAT JOHN BAILEY OF MASSACHUSETTS IS NOT ENTITLED TO A SEAT IN THE HOUSE.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION RESCINDING RULE 84 WHICH FORBIDS A MOTION TO RISE PRIOR TO 4 O'CLOCK WHILE A QUESTION IS PEND- ING IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE.

TO AMEND THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 77 (APP. 4/2/1824), A BILL MAKING GENERAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR 1824, BY APPROPRI- ATING $2,000 PER YEAR FOR AN ATTORNEY EMPLOYED BY THE PRESIDENT TO DETERMINE THE VALUE OF THE SLAVES TAKEN BY ENGLAND IN THE LAST WAR.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION CHANGING THE HOUR OF MEETING TO 11 A.M.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 47 (136-4 STAT. 25, APP. 5/22/1824), A BILL AMEND- ING THE SEVERAL ACTS IMPOSING DUTIES ON IMPORTS, WHICH AMENDMENT REDUCES THE MINIMUM ON WOOLENS FROM 80 TO 40 CENTS PER SQUARE YARD.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE CONCURRING IN THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT REDUCES THE MINIMUM ON WOOLENS FROM 80 TO 40 CENTS PER SQUARE YARD.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT REDUCES THE MINIMUM ON WOOLENS FROM 80 TO 40 CENTS PER SQUARE YARD.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT REDUCES THE DUTY ON IRON BARS FROM $1.12 TO $.90 PER CWT.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT IMPOSES A DUTY OF 30% AD VALOREM ON ALL FIREARMS AND SIDE ARMS.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H.R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT REDUCES THE DUTY ON FRYING PANS.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT IMPOSES A DUTY OF 10 CENTS PER GALLON ON MOLASSES.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT IM- POSES ON ANY IMPORTED ARTICLE THE AMOUNT OF BOUNTY OR PRE- MIUM ALLOWED ON THE ARTICLE IN THAT COUNTRY.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT IMPOSES A DUTY OF 30 CENTS PER GALLON ON WINES.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY PROVIDING THAT THE 4 1/2 CENTS PER SQ. YARD DUTY ON COTTON BAGGING BE CHANGED ON 6/30/1824 TO 6 CENTS.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY DISCONTINUING THE MINIMUM VALUATION OF WOOLENS AND GRADUALLY RAISING THE DUTY ON WOOLENS TO 37 1/2% BY 6/30/1826.
TO AMEND H. R. 47 BY STRIKING OUT THE ENTIRE SECTION LAYING DUTIES ON WOOLENS.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTION LAYING DUTIES ON BAR IRON.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY REDUCING THE MINIMUM VALUATION ON ALL COTTON GOODS FROM 35 TO 25 CENTS PER SQ. YARD.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY STRIKING OUT THE DUTIES ON UNMANUFAC- TURED WOOL.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY IMPOSING A DUTY OF 2 CENTS PER POUND ON BROWN SUGAR AND 3 CENTS ON WHITE SUGAR.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY GRADUALLY INCREASING THE DUTY ON COTTON BAGGING TO 5 1/2 CENTS PER SQUARE YARD BY 6/30/1825; SPEAKER VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTION IMPOSING AN ADDITIONAL DUTY ON IMPORTED SPIRITS.

TO ADOPT THE FIRST SECTION OF THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT IMPOSES VARIOUS DUTIES ON IMPORTED BOOKS; THE FIRST SECTION IMPOSES A DUTY OF 4 CENTS ON EACH VOLUME PRINTED PRIOR TO 1775 OR IN A FOREIGN LANGUAGE.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY REDUCING THE DUTY ON BROWN SUGAR TO 2 1/2 CENTS PER POUND.
TO POSTPONE H. R. 47 TO 12/1/1824.
TO AMEND H. R. 47, BY REDUCING THE DUTY ON SALT TO 10 CENTS PER BUSHEL.
TO ORDER THE MAIN QUESTION ON THE MOTION TO ORDER ENGROSS- MENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 47.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 47.
TO FIX 7/4/1824 AS THE DAY FOR THE THIRD READING OF H. R. 47.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE JOINT RESOLUTION FIXING A DAY FOR THE ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.
TO TABLE H. R. 47.
TO ORDER THE MAIN QUESTION ON H. R. 47.
TO PASS H. R. 47.
TO AMEND H. R. 88 (APP. 4/29/1824), A BILL MAKING APPROPRI- ATIONS FOR ERECTING FORTIFICATIONS FOR 1824, BY ELIMINATING THE APPROPRIATION OF $50,000 FOR A FORTIFICATION ON NARRAGANSET BAY.
TO RECOMMIT H. R. 88 (APP. 4/29/1824), TO THE COMMITTEE OF WAYS AND MEANS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REDUCE THE TOTAL SUM APPROPRIATED TO $500,000.
TO REFER THE JOINT RESOLUTION FIXING THE TIME OF ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS TO A JOINT COMMITTEE.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 16, A BILL RELATING TO THE CLAIM OF PENELOPE DENNY.
TO RESCIND THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE HOUSE ADJOURN DAILY FROM 2 TO 4 P.M.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 17 (APP. 5/19/1824), A BILL RELATING TO THE CLAIMS OF DANIEL CARROLL AND OTHERS.
TO PASS H. R. 17 (APP. 5/19/1824), A BILL RELATING TO THE CLAIMS OF DANIEL CARROLL AND OTHERS.
TO TABLE THE JOINT RESOLUTION FIXING THE DATE OF ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.
TO PASS H. R. 60 (APP. 5/19/1824), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF CERTAIN PERSONS WHO HAVE PAID DUTIES ON CERTAIN GOODS IMPOR- TED INTO CASTINE.

TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION UNTIL 12/1/1824 OF H. R. 42 (APP. 5/22/1824), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE CREATION OF STOCK NOT EXCEEDING $5 MILLION, TO PROVIDE FOR THE AWARDS UNDER THE TREATY WITH SPAIN OF 2/22/1819.
TO PASS H. R. 42.
TO PASS H. R. 139 (APP. 5/22/1824), A BILL MAKING APPROPRI- ATIONS FOR IMPROVING THE NAVIGATION OF THE OHIO AND MISSIS- SIPPI RIVERS.

TO TABLE S. J. RES. 12, FIXING THE TIME FOR THE ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.
TO CONCUR IN THE RESOLUTION OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE RE- QUISTING THE PRESIDENT TO SUBMIT A REPORT ON 12/1/1824, ON THE NUMBER AND STATUS OF LOTS OWNED BY THE U. S. IN WASHINGTON, D. C.
TO GO INTO COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO CONSIDER SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 47.
TO CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 47, ADDING A PRO- VISO THAT THE DUTY ON SPECIFIED WOOLENS BE REDUCED TO 25% AD VALOREM.

TO CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 47, ELIMINATING THE DUTY ON DISTILLED SPIRITS.

TO RECEDE FROM THE DISAGREEMENT WITH THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT ADDS A PROVISO REDUCING THE DUTY ON SPECIFIED WOOLENS.
TO RECEDE FROM THE DISAGREEMENT WITH THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 47, WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THE DUTY ON COTTON BAGGING.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF S. J. RES. 12, FIXING THE TIME FOR ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.
TO TABLE S. J. RES. 12, FIXING THE TIME FOR THE ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.

TO AMEND H. R. 137 (APP. 5/26/1824), A BILL ESTABLISHING A TERRITORIAL GOVERNMENT IN FLORIDA, BY STRIKING OUT THE SUM OF $500 FOR THE SALARY OF THE DISTRT ATTORNEY INSERTING THE SUM EQUAL TO THE SALARY OF THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY OF KENTUCKY.

TO AGREE TO THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE ON H.R. 47.

TO PASS H. R. 185, A BILL DISCONTINUING CERTAIN POST ROADS AND ESTABLISHING OTHERS.

TO DECIDE TO ELIMINATE THE WORDS "SEMINOLE TRIBE" FROM THE RESOLUTION.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION BY SUBSTITUTING THE WORDS "FLORIDA TRIBES", INSTEAD OF "SEMINOLE TRIBES."
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION.

TO AMEND S. 2, (APP. 1-7-24), A BILL REVIVING AND CONTINUING IN FORCE CERTAIN ACTS RELATIVE TO DISCRIMINATING DUTIES ON IMPORTS AND TONNAGE, BY APPLYING THIS ACT TO NATIONS WHOSE INDEPENDENCE THE U.S. HAS RECOGNIZED.  (P. 76)

TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL, PROVIDING FOR CORRECTION OF CERTAIN ERRORS ALLEGED TO HAVE BEEN COMMITTED IN THE SETTLEMENT OF ACCOUNTS OF COL. JOHN LAURENS, BY INCREASING FROM $23,500 TO $26,700 THE COMPENSATION DUE.  (P. 47)

TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE U.S. CONSTITUTION, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT "NO PERSON HAVING BEEN TWICE ELECTED TO THE OFFICE OF PRESIDENT SHALL AGAIN BE ELIGIBLE TO THAT OFFICE".  (P. 159)

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF ALEXANDER W. HAMILTON AS COLLECTOR OF THE PORT OF PENSACOLA.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 31.  (P. 333)

TO INDEFINITELY POSTPONE THE CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION PROPOSING AMENDMENTS TO THE CONSTITUTION RELATIVE TO ELECTION OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT.  (P. 402)

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 77, (4 STAT. 11, 4-2-24), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR 1824; WHICH ORIGINAL AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $2,500, PLUS BALANCE OF LAST YEAR'S APPROPRIATION, FOR PAYMENT OF SALARIES OF COMMISSIONERAND ARBITRATOR UNDER THE FIRST ARTICLE OF THE TREATY OF GHENT:  WHICH AMENDMENT TO THE AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR A "PUBLIC AGENT" TO TAKE CARE OF CLAIMS BEFORE THE COMMISSION

TO AMEND S. 9, (4 STAT. 19, 4-22-24), A BILL ABOLISHING IMPRISONMENT FOR DEBT, BY ADDING A PROVISO "THAT NO PERSON SHALL BE HELD TO BAIL ON MESNE PROCESS, EXCEPT IN THE STATE WHERE PARTIES RESIDE OR IN WHICH THE DEBT WAS CONTRACTED, UNLESS THE DEBTOR HASABSCONDED FROM THE STATE IN WHICH HE RESIDED".
TO POSTPONE INDIFINETILY CONSIDERATION OF S. 9.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE BY WHICH S. 9, WAS RECOMMITTED TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY WITH INSTRUCTIONS.  (P. 503A)
TO POSTPONE INDEFINETELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 9.  (P. 503B)
TO PASS S. 9.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION FIXING NEXT MAY 4TH AS THE DATE FOR ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.  (P. 515)

TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF BARNABAS BATES AS COLLECTOR FOR THE DISTRICT OF BRISTOL AND WARREN, RHODE ISLAND.

TO AMEND H.R. 5, (4 STAT. 22, 4-30-24), A BILL PROCURING THE NECESSARY SURVEYS AND ESTIMATES FOR ROADS AND CANALS; WHICH AMENDMENT IS IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE BILL, MAKING IT MORE SPECIFIC, RETAINING THE $30,000 APPROPRIATION BUT DEFINING TH USES TO WHICH IT SHALL BE PUT

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT H.R. 5, BY ADDING A PROVISO THAT THE PRESIDENT MUST FIRST OBTAIN CONSENT OF THE STATE IN WHICH SURVEY IS TO BE MADE TO THE AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT NOTHING IN THIS ACT ADMITS OR AFFIRMS THE POWER OF CONGRESS, ON ITS OWN AUTHORITY, O BUILD ROADS OR CANALS

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5, BY CHANGING THE WORD "ADMIT" TO "DENY" IN THE PROVISO PROVIDING THAT NOTHING CONTAINED IN THIS ACT SHALL BE TAKEN TO AFFIRM OR DENY THE POWER OF CONGRESS, ON ITS OWN AUTHORITY, TO MAKE ROADS AND CANALS IN ANY STATE.  (P. 67B)
TO AMEND H.R. 5, BY PROVIDING THAT NOTHING IN THIS ACT SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO AFFIRM OR ADMIT A POWER IN CONGRESS, ON ITS OWN AUTHORITY, TO MAKE ROADS OR CANALS WITHIN ANY OF THE STATES.  (P. 567C)

TO AMEND H.R. 5, BY PLEDGING THE FAITH OF THE U.S. THAT NO MONEY SHALL BE SPENT FOR ROADS OR CANALS, EXCEPT IT BE AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES, AND IN THE SAME PROPORTION AS DIRECT TAXES ARE LAID AND ASSESSED, UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE CONSTITUTION.  (P. 58A)
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF H.R. 5.  (P. 568B)
TO PASS THE SENATE BILL, PROVIDING FOR THE SETTLEMENT OF CERTAIN PECUNIARY CLAIMS AGAINST THE U.S.
TO PASS H.R. 5.  (P. 558, 570B)

TO AMEND H.R. 47, BY ELIMINATING THE DUTY OF 2 CENTS PER POUND ON HEMP.

TO AMEND H.R. 47, BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF THE BILL WHICH ESTABLISHES THE MINIMUM FOR THE CALCULATION OF THE DUTIES ON COTTON CLOTHS, COTTON TWIST, YARN OR THREAD.  (P. 702)

TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION (7 STAT. 237, 3-7-25), PROVIDING THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CREEK INDIANS, MADE AND CONCLUDED ON 2-12-25, AT INDIAN SPRINGS.
